item.title: [TIKA-2759] ScriptsExtractor incorrectly reports Javascript to characters() in SAX ContentHandler
item.description:
We extract Javascript as text content while instead it is actually a script tag with base64 inline. This inline code is decoded and reported in the characters() method of our custom ContentHandler, and ends up as text being extracted, but it seems the Javascript start tag itself is never reported to startElement(). The Javascript is reported to characters() after we left the head and entered the body.

HTML file is attached

The following script tag:

  <script src="data:text/javascript;base64," type="text/javascript"></script>

gets reported outside the head (in html.p) as:

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
We added extraction of data: uri nodes, but I failed to check to see if we were in a <script> element.

The default behavior is to skip <script/> content and (now) to skip data: uri processing. data: uri elements that are not inside of scripts will still be extracted.

If the user wants data: uri content to be extracted from the <script/> elements, s/he can configure the parser to extract <script/> content.

Thank you markus17 for catching this!!!

As a side note, with the RecursiveParserWrapper, the script content was correctly put in an object separate from the main content. However, this was still incorrect because the default behavior is to skip <script/> data.
